metadata.description:
The data set contains meteorological observation data of zhangye wetland station in the middle reaches of heihe hydrometeorological observation network from January 1, 2016 to December 31, 2016.The site is located in zhangye national wetland park in gansu province.The latitude and longitude of the observation point is 100.4464E, 38.9751N, and altitude is 1460m.Air temperature and relative humidity sensors are set up at 5m and 10m, facing due north.The barometer is installed at 2m;The inverted bucket rain gauge is installed at 10m;The wind speed sensor is set up at 5m and 10m, and the wind direction sensor is set up at 10m, facing due north.The four-component radiometer is installed at 6m, facing due south;The two infrared thermometers are installed at the position of 6m, facing south, and the probe is facing vertically downward.The soil temperature probe is buried at 0cm on the surface and 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm and 40cm underground, in the south due to 2m from the meteorological tower.The soil hot flow plates (3) are successively buried in the ground 6cm;Four photosynthetic radiometers are installed above and inside the canopy respectively. The upper part of the canopy is installed at 6m (one probe vertically up and one probe vertically down), and the upper part of the canopy is installed at 0.25m (one probe vertically up and one probe vertically down), facing due south.
Observation items are: air temperature and humidity (Ta_5m RH_5m Ta_10m, RH_10m) (unit: c, percentage), pressure (Press) (unit: hundred mpa), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), wind speed (WS_5m, WS_10m) (unit: m/s), wind (WD_10m) (unit: degrees), the radiation of four component (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watts per square meter), the surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit:Degrees Celsius), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (unit: watts per square meter), soil temperature (Ts_0cm Ts_2cm Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_20cm, Ts_40cm) (unit: c), the canopy on the up and down photosynthetic active radiation (PAR_U_up, PAR_U_down) (unit: second micromoles/m2) and up and down under canopy photosynthetic active radiation (PAR_D_up, PAR_D_down) (unit: second micromoles/m2).
Processing and quality control of observation data :(1) ensure 144 data per day (every 10min). If data is missing, it will be marked by -6999;(2) eliminate the moments with duplicate records;(3) data that is obviously beyond the physical meaning or the range of the instrument is deleted;(4) the part marked by red letter in the data is the data in question;(5) the format of date and time is uniform, and the date and time are in the same column.For example, the time is: 2016-6-10-10:30;(6) the naming rule is: AWS+ site name.
Please refer to Li et al. (2013) for hydrometeorological network or site information, and Liu et al. (2011) for observation data processing.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2016年1月1日至2016年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网中游张掖湿地站气象要素观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市国家湿地公园，下垫面是芦苇湿地。观测点的经纬度是100.4464E, 38.9751N，海拔1460m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m、10m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在2m处；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速传感器架设在5m、10m处，风向传感器架设在10m处，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处；四个光合有效辐射仪分别架设在冠层上方和冠层内，冠层上方安装在6m（探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个）、冠层内安装在0.25m（探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个）高处，朝向正南。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m、Ta_10m、RH_10m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_5m、WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm）(单位：摄氏度)、冠层上向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_U_up、PAR_U_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)和冠层下向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_D_up、PAR_D_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2016-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 两源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“冠层上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况下。水蒸气和热量在冠层内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过冠层顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射仪视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层），并与使用波文比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果进行了比较。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在涡度协方差（EC）通量测量的潜热（LE）和感热（H）与可用能量（Rn−G0）之间存在能量平衡闭合不完全的情况下。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，观察到的E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，通过一系列TSEB模型来估计蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡动相关（EC）测量来更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的，这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当 irrigated farmland 的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的入射短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的空气温度、风速和湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用10 Hz采样频率的EC系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）来计算。土壤和冠层的组件温度是使用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）及其在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中的蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）的比率，该实验是河西水文遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估算的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估算也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的上升尺度是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅呈现2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个涡度协方差（EC）塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了强烈观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计，对FEA进行了覆盖。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，尤其是在中国西部，该地区自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域已被先前研究者发现为碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护生态稳定性和绿洲的社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，风速和风向的梯度；空气压力、降水和土壤湿度剖面）通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期进行观测，同时还观察了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，其中包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Example.QuestionCn: 在收集异质表面上的多尺度生态水文数据时面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: A challenge in collecting multiscale eco-hydrological data is the poor availability of multiscale observations, which hinders progress in understanding and modeling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces.
Example.AnswerCn: 收集多尺度生态水文数据的一个挑战是多尺度观测的可用性较差，这阻碍了对异质表面生态水文过程的理解和建模的进展。

Example.AnswerEn: A dataset used for this purpose includes data from the Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER), which consists of multiscale observations such as eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing. This dataset supports the study of evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces.
Example.AnswerCn: 用于此目的的数据集包括来自黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）的数据，该数据集包含多尺度观测，如涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站和超高分辨率航空遥感。这一数据集支持对异质土地表面的蒸散发研究。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods for measuring evapotranspiration using the TSEB model compare to those used in the HiWATER experiment for eco-hydrological processes?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 测量蒸散发的TSEB模型的数据收集方法与HiWATER实验在生态水文过程中的数据收集方法相比如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The TSEB model data collection involves ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures, thermal infrared camera observations, and eddy covariance measurements to estimate evapotranspiration components. In contrast, the HiWATER experiment employs a multiscale approach using eddy covariance towers, automatic meteorological stations, and airborne remote sensing to capture eco-hydrological processes at various scales.
Comparison.AnswerCn: TSEB模型数据收集涉及地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度、热红外相机观测以及涡度协方差测量，以估算蒸散发组分。相比之下，HiWATER实验采用多尺度方法，使用涡度协方差塔、自动气象站和航空遥感技术，在不同尺度上捕捉生态水文过程。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in data quality control procedures between datasets obtained from the 张掖湿地 station and those used in the oasis-desert system study?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 张掖湿地站获得的数据集与绿洲-沙漠系统研究中使用的数据集在数据质量控制程序方面有什么区别？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The 张掖湿地 station dataset follows a quality control process that includes marking missing data, removing duplicates, and flagging doubtful data. In comparison, the oasis-desert system study's quality control involves data collection, processing, archiving, and includes sensor calibration. Both datasets emphasize ensuring data accuracy and reliability, but the oasis-desert system includes additional processing and archiving steps.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 张掖湿地站的数据集遵循质量控制流程，包括标记缺失数据、去除重复数据和标记可疑数据。相比之下，绿洲-沙漠系统研究的质量控制涉及数据收集、处理、归档，并包括传感器校准。两个数据集都强调确保数据的准确性和可靠性，但绿洲-沙漠系统还包括额外的处理和归档步骤。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can the spatial heterogeneity of the oasis-desert system be interpreted through multiscale data collection techniques and what are the implications for understanding eco-hydrological processes?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 如何通过多尺度数据收集技术解释绿洲-沙漠系统的空间异质性，以及这对理解生态水文过程的影响。
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The spatial heterogeneity of the oasis-desert system can be interpreted through multiscale data collection techniques by employing hierarchically nested instrumentation, such as eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations. This multiscale approach allows for capturing eco-hydrological processes across different landscape types, including sandy deserts, desert pavements, desert steppes, and wetlands. These comprehensive observations are crucial for understanding the interactions between oasis and desert systems, and they support research on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges, which are critical for sustainable oasis development.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 绿洲-沙漠系统的空间异质性可以通过多尺度数据收集技术进行解释，采用分层嵌套的仪器，如涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站。这种多尺度的方法能够捕捉不同景观类型（包括沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地）中的生态水文过程。这些全面的观测对于理解绿洲与沙漠系统之间的相互作用至关重要，并支持对能量、水汽和碳交换的研究，这对可持续的绿洲发展至关重要。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: In what ways do the challenges of measuring energy fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas affect the interpretation of surface flux data, and how might these challenges be addressed?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在强对流灌溉农业区域，测量能量通量的挑战如何影响对表面通量数据的解释，以及如何应对这些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The challenges of measuring energy fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas, such as the incomplete energy balance closure in EC flux measurements, can significantly affect the interpretation of surface flux data. Errors in surface-air temperature differences can dominate due to inaccuracies in determining soil and vegetation component temperatures. Addressing these challenges requires robust methodologies for calculating component temperatures and improving data accuracy, such as using high-precision thermal infrared cameras and refining models like the TSEB to better separate latent and sensible heat fluxes.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 在强对流灌溉农业区域，测量能量通量的挑战，如涡度协方差（EC）通量测量中的能量平衡闭合不完全，可能会显著影响对表面通量数据的解释。由于在确定土壤和植被组分温度时的误差，表面与空气温度差的错误可能占主导地位。解决这些挑战需要采用稳健的方法来计算组分温度并提高数据准确性，例如使用高精度热红外相机和改进像TSEB这样的模型，以更好地区分潜热和显热通量。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What are the implications of using stable isotopes and thermal imagery in estimating evapotranspiration components, and how might these methods enhance the understanding of water resource management?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 使用稳定同位素和热成像技术来估算蒸散发成分的影响是什么，这些方法如何增强对水资源管理的理解？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Using stable isotopes and thermal imagery in estimating evapotranspiration components provides a more detailed understanding of the partitioning between evaporation and transpiration. These methods enhance the accuracy of ET measurements, which is essential for water resource management, especially in heterogeneous landscapes with mixed soil and vegetation. By providing a robust estimation of E and T, these techniques support the development of better water management strategies and improve the ecological stability of arid regions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 使用稳定同位素和热成像技术来估算蒸散发成分，可以更详细地理解蒸发和蒸腾之间的分配。这些方法提高了蒸散发测量的准确性，这对于水资源管理至关重要，尤其是在土壤和植被混合的异质景观中。通过提供对蒸发和蒸腾的可靠估算，这些技术支持更好的水管理策略的发展，并改善干旱地区的生态稳定性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What contributes to the challenges in obtaining accurate multiscale observations for eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，获取生态水文过程的准确多尺度观测面临哪些挑战？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Progress in the field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations, which can be attributed to the complexity of capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales, as well as the logistical challenges of conducting intensive observation periods and continuous hydrometeorological observations in diverse and remote landscapes.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的制约，这可以归因于通过分层嵌套尺度的仪器捕捉多尺度生态水文过程的复杂性，以及在多样化和偏远的景观中进行密集观测期和持续水文气象观测的后勤挑战。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it difficult to accurately estimate evapotranspiration in landscapes with heterogeneous soil and vegetation components?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在具有异质土壤和植被组成的景观中，准确估计蒸散发是困难的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The difficulty arises because one-source models combine soil and vegetation components into a single source, which fails to account for the mixture of soil and vegetation with different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. This heterogeneity leads to inaccuracies in estimating surface evapotranspiration, as the effect of varying surface conditions on energy partitioning is not captured.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 困难在于单源模型将土壤和植被成分合并为一个单一来源，这未能考虑土壤和植被在不同温度和能量交换阻力下的混合。这种异质性导致在估算表面蒸散时出现不准确，因为不同表面条件对能量分配的影响未被捕捉到。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the reasons for the errors in estimating soil and canopy component temperatures when using thermal infrared imagery in agricultural areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在农业地区使用热红外影像估计土壤和冠层组分温度时，出现误差的原因有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Errors in estimating soil and canopy component temperatures can be caused by image classification errors that vary with vegetation abundance, the misclassification of soil and vegetation pixels, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance, and uncertainties in short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy. These factors contribute to the overestimation of canopy temperature and inaccuracies in component temperature separation.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 估计土壤和冠层组分温度的误差可能由以下因素引起：图像分类错误随植被丰度变化、土壤和植被像素的误分类、忽略大气向上辐射和透射、以及冠层内短波和长波辐射透射的不确定性。这些因素导致冠层温度的过高估计和组分温度分离的不准确。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential outcomes of utilizing a multi-scale observation system, such as the one employed in Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER), on understanding eco-hydrological processes?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 利用多尺度观测系统（如在黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）中采用的系统）对理解生态水文过程的潜在结果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Utilizing a multi-scale observation system allows for the capture of eco-hydrological processes at various scales, which can significantly improve the understanding of interactions in oasis-desert systems. It helps in addressing the challenge of upscaling observations across heterogeneous surfaces, providing comprehensive data that integrates both field and remote sensing observations. This leads to better insights into energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges, supporting ecological security and sustainable development.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 利用多尺度观测系统可以在不同尺度上捕捉生态水文过程，这有助于显著提高对绿洲-沙漠系统中相互作用的理解。它有助于解决在异质表面上进行观测上升的挑战，提供综合数据，整合了现场和遥感观测。这将带来对能量、水蒸气和碳交换的更好洞察，支持生态安全和可持续发展。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the objectives behind the development of multiscale datasets for eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous surfaces?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 开发多尺度数据集以研究异质表面的生态水文过程的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objectives behind developing multiscale datasets for eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces include addressing the challenge of limited multiscale observations, capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes, and improving the understanding of oasis-desert interactions. This is crucial for recognizing the interactions and ensuring the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 开发多尺度生态水文过程数据集的目标包括应对多尺度观测有限的挑战、捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，以及改善对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的理解。这对于认识相互作用、确保绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it necessary to implement a comprehensive data collection method in oasis-desert systems to study energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中实施全面的数据收集方法，以研究能量、水蒸气和碳交换是必要的，原因如下：
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: It is necessary to implement comprehensive data collection methods in oasis-desert systems to study energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange because these systems play a crucial role in maintaining ecological stability and agricultural productivity. Understanding these exchanges is vital for achieving carbon neutrality and supporting ecological security and sustainable development in arid regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中实施全面的数据收集方法，以研究能量、水蒸气和碳交换是必要的，因为这些系统在维持生态稳定性和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用。理解这些交换对于实现碳中和、支持生态安全和可持续发展在干旱地区至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the goal of using ground-based and remote-sensing observations in the HiWATER project for understanding oasis-desert interactions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: HiWATER项目中使用地面观测和遥感观测的目标是理解绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用。
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal of using ground-based and remote-sensing observations in the HiWATER project is to overcome the challenge of poor availability of multiscale observations and to provide a quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert areas. This helps in recognizing oasis-desert interactions and contributes to ecological stability and sustainable development.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: HiWATER项目中使用地面和遥感观测的目标是克服多尺度观测稀缺的挑战，并提供对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解。这有助于识别绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用，并促进生态稳定和可持续发展。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What specific procedures are employed to ensure quality control and data accuracy when collecting hydrometeorological data in the context of oasis-desert ecosystems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在收集绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的水文气象数据时，采用了哪些具体程序来确保质量控制和数据准确性？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Hydrometeorological data quality control involves several steps, including ensuring the collection of 144 data points per day (every 10 minutes), marking missing data with -6999, removing duplicate records, deleting data outside physical or instrument range, and flagging questionable data in red. The data processing and quality control procedure is divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 水文气象数据质量控制涉及多个步骤，包括确保每天收集144个数据点（每10分钟一次），用-6999标记缺失数据，删除重复记录，删除超出物理或仪器范围的数据，并将可疑数据标记为红色。数据处理和质量控制程序分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are ground-based and remote sensing measurements integrated in the collection of data for energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange studies in arid regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，地面观测和遥感测量如何结合用于能量、水蒸气和碳交换研究的数据收集？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Data integration involves using a network of eddy covariance towers, automatic meteorological stations, and remote sensing instruments such as LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, multi-angle thermal imagers, and microwave radiometers. Ground-based measurements, such as turbulent fluxes and hydrometeorological data, are supplemented by airborne remote sensing missions to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据集成涉及使用涡度协方差塔、自动气象站和遥感仪器，如激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和微波辐射计。地面测量，如湍流通量和水文气象数据，通过空中遥感任务进行补充，以捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methodologies are utilized to separate soil and vegetation component temperatures for accurate evapotranspiration modeling in heterogeneous landscapes?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中，为了准确建模蒸散发，采用了哪些方法来分离土壤和植被成分的温度？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The separation of soil and vegetation component temperatures involves using high-resolution thermal cameras to obtain radiometric temperatures. Visible and NIR images are classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. The thermal infrared temperatures are converted to radiation temperatures using incoming long-wave radiation and emissivity data, which are validated against surface radiometric temperatures calculated from four-component radiometer data.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 土壤和植被成分温度的分离涉及使用高分辨率热像仪获取辐射温度。可见光和近红外图像通过最大似然法分类为土壤像素和冠层像素。热红外温度通过入射长波辐射和发射率数据转换为辐射温度，并与从四分量辐射计数据计算的表面辐射温度进行验证。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements have enabled the collection of comprehensive eco-hydrological data in oasis-desert areas?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在绿洲-沙漠地区收集全面的生态水文数据成为可能？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of instruments arranged in hierarchically nested scales, such as eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, multi-angle thermal imagers, and L-band microwave radiometers, have enabled comprehensive data collection in oasis-desert areas.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区，使用层次嵌套尺度排列的仪器，如涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站以及使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的高分辨率航空遥感，已实现全面的数据收集。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do specific data processing and quality control methods ensure the reliability of meteorological measurements in heterogeneous landscapes?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 具体的数据处理和质量控制方法如何确保在异质景观中气象测量的可靠性？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Data processing and quality control methods, such as ensuring data completeness with daily checks, removing duplicate records, deleting physically implausible data, and marking questionable data in red, ensure the reliability of meteorological measurements in heterogeneous landscapes.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 数据处理和质量控制方法，如通过每日检查确保数据完整性、删除重复记录、删除物理上不合理的数据以及将可疑数据标记为红色，确保了异质景观中气象测量的可靠性。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What methodologies enable the accurate partitioning of evapotranspiration into soil evaporation and transpiration in strongly advective regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些方法能够在强烈的对流区域中准确地将蒸散发分为土壤蒸发和植物蒸腾？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures, a high-resolution thermal camera for temperature inputs, and the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique, combined with eddy covariance measurements, enable accurate partitioning of evapotranspiration into soil evaporation and transpiration in strongly advective regions.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 使用地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度、高分辨率热像仪获取温度输入，以及稳定的氧和氢同位素技术，结合涡度协方差测量，可以在强烈的平流区域中准确地将蒸散发分为土壤蒸发和植物蒸腾。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is it expected that the separation of latent fluxes of soil and vegetation components can be achieved with reasonable accuracy in arid areas using specific models?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么预计在干旱地区使用特定模型可以合理准确地实现土壤和植被成分的潜热通量分离？
Expectation.AnswerEn: It is expected that the separation of latent fluxes of soil and vegetation components can be achieved with reasonable accuracy using the TSEB model because the model has been refined to use soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which are validated against ground-based measurements, allowing for reliable estimates even under strongly advective conditions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 预计通过TSEB模型可以合理准确地分离土壤和植被成分的潜热通量，因为该模型经过改进，使用了经过地面测量验证的土壤和冠层成分的辐射温度，从而在强对流条件下也能提供可靠的估计。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How effective do you think the use of automated meteorological stations is in capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我认为自动气象站在捕捉绿洲-沙漠系统中的多尺度生态水文过程方面是非常有效的。
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The use of automated meteorological stations is crucial in capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes, especially when arranged in hierarchically nested scales. This setup allows for comprehensive data collection across different landscapes, which is essential for understanding complex interactions within oasis-desert systems. The data collected provides valuable insights into the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges, which are vital for ecological stability and socioeconomic development.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 自动气象站的使用对于捕捉多尺度生态水文过程至关重要，特别是当它们以层次嵌套的方式排列时。这种设置允许在不同的景观中进行全面的数据收集，这对于理解绿洲-沙漠系统内复杂的相互作用至关重要。收集的数据提供了关于能量、水蒸气和碳交换的宝贵见解，这些对于生态稳定和社会经济发展是必不可少的。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In your opinion, what are the main challenges in ensuring the accuracy and reliability of data collected during intensive observation periods in arid regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区进行密集观察期间，确保收集数据的准确性和可靠性面临的主要挑战是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: One of the main challenges in ensuring data accuracy and reliability during intensive observation periods in arid regions is the limited effectiveness of current temperature separation approaches, particularly in arid environments. Additionally, errors in image classification can lead to inaccurate temperature estimations, which impacts the reliability of models such as the TSEB. The strong advective conditions in these regions further complicate measurements, as they can affect the energy balance closure and increase uncertainty in flux measurements.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区的密集观测期间，确保数据准确性和可靠性面临的主要挑战之一是当前温度分离方法的有效性有限，特别是在干旱环境中。此外，图像分类中的错误可能导致温度估计不准确，这影响了诸如TSEB等模型的可靠性。这些地区强烈的平流条件进一步复杂化了测量，因为它们可能影响能量平衡的闭合，并增加通量测量的不确定性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your evaluation of the role of ground-based measurements in enhancing the accuracy of evapotranspiration models in heterogeneous landscapes?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我对地面测量在提高异质景观蒸散发模型准确性方面的作用的评估是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Ground-based measurements play a critical role in enhancing the accuracy of evapotranspiration models, especially in heterogeneous landscapes. By providing direct measures of soil and canopy component temperatures, ground-based data helps to refine models like the TSEB. This approach allows for better validation of evaporation and transpiration estimates, offering a reliable means to separate soil and vegetation components accurately. The use of high-resolution thermal imagery further supports these measurements by providing detailed observations that improve model inputs and outputs.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 地面测量在提高蒸散发模型的准确性方面发挥着关键作用，尤其是在异质景观中。通过提供土壤和树冠组件温度的直接测量，地面数据有助于优化像TSEB这样的模型。这种方法允许更好地验证蒸发和蒸腾的估算，提供了一种可靠的手段来准确分离土壤和植被组件。高分辨率热成像的使用进一步支持这些测量，通过提供详细的观察结果来改善模型的输入和输出。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how data collection methods can ensure quality control across different sensors and instruments in eco-hydrological studies.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解数据收集方法如何在生态水文研究中确保不同传感器和仪器的质量控制。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Quality control in eco-hydrological studies is achieved through multiple steps, including ensuring that each day has a complete set of data entries (like 144 data points for 10-minute intervals), marking missing data with specific values (e.g., -6999), and removing duplicate records or data that exceed physical or instrumental ranges.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 生态水文学研究中的质量控制通过多个步骤实现，包括确保每天都有完整的数据条目（例如，10分钟间隔的144个数据点），用特定值（例如，-6999）标记缺失数据，以及删除重复记录或超出物理或仪器范围的数据。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand why it is challenging to obtain multiscale eco-hydrological data in oasis-desert systems.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白为什么在绿洲-沙漠系统中获取多尺度生态水文数据是具有挑战性的。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The challenge in obtaining multiscale eco-hydrological data lies in the poor availability of multiscale observations and the complexity of arranging instruments on hierarchically nested scales to capture processes across different landscapes, such as deserts, steppes, and wetlands.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 获取多尺度生态水文数据的挑战在于多尺度观测的可用性较差，以及在分层嵌套尺度上布置仪器以捕捉不同景观（如沙漠、草原和湿地）中的过程的复杂性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please summarize the methodologies used for data collection in hydrometeorological networks and discuss any unique challenges faced in arid and semi-arid regions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 总结水文气象网络中数据收集的方法，并讨论在干旱和半干旱地区面临的独特挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Data collection in hydrometeorological networks in arid and semi-arid regions involves the use of eddy covariance systems, automatic meteorological stations, and other remote sensing technologies like LiDAR and thermal imagers. Challenges include the poor availability of multiscale observations, image classification errors, and uncertainties due to the heterogeneous nature of the surface and atmospheric conditions.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区的水文气象网络中，数据收集涉及使用涡度协方差系统、自动气象站以及其他遥感技术，如激光雷达（LiDAR）和热成像仪。挑战包括多尺度观测的可用性差、图像分类错误以及由于表面和大气条件的异质性带来的不确定性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the effectiveness of employing thermal infrared cameras in capturing soil and canopy temperatures for evapotranspiration estimation.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 分析使用热红外相机捕捉土壤和冠层温度以估算蒸散发的有效性。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Thermal infrared cameras are effective in capturing soil and canopy temperatures, which are crucial for estimating evapotranspiration using models like the TSEB. Despite the effectiveness, challenges such as image classification errors and uncertainties in temperature derivation due to atmospheric conditions exist, affecting the accuracy of the estimates.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 热红外相机在捕捉土壤和树冠温度方面非常有效，这对于使用像TSEB这样的模型估算蒸散发至关重要。尽管效果显著，但图像分类错误和由于大气条件导致的温度推导不确定性等挑战仍然存在，这影响了估算的准确性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore potential data sources and strategies for enhancing dataset comprehensiveness in oasis–desert ecosystems to improve the understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探索潜在的数据来源和策略，以增强绿洲-沙漠生态系统的数据集的全面性，从而改善对能量、水汽和碳交换的理解。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential data sources for enhancing dataset comprehensiveness in oasis–desert ecosystems include long-term observations from flux and meteorological stations, airborne remote sensing missions, and eco-hydrological sensor networks. Strategies could involve integrating multi-scale and multidisciplinary data, improving sensor calibration, and conducting intensive observation periods across different landscapes.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 增强绿洲-沙漠生态系统数据集全面性的潜在数据来源包括来自通量和气象站的长期观测、空中遥感任务以及生态水文传感器网络。策略可以包括整合多尺度和多学科数据、改善传感器校准，以及在不同景观上进行密集观测期。
